results.title: Ageing Parents
results.brief_description: Many children regard their parents as a burden. This thought-provoking program explores what it feels like to get older. Elderly parents, their children and teenagers talk about how they relate to each other, their expectations and ways of keeping the lines of communication open - before it’s too late.

results.title: Age, common interest and stratification
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Faces of culture”.
In small societies, family and kinship groups are sufficient to provide the support the individual needs, but in larger, more complex societies other groups are formed. These groups can enhance, maintain or even change societies. They organise diversity, provide structure, integrate people, and reflect the values of a culture. These groups may be formed through common special interests, age, ethnic background or social class and may be dictated by need, birth or lifestyle. Examples shown include the Masai people, The Brotherhood of Black Sleeping Car Porters, The Young Skulls Gang, college fraternities, South African apartheid and the Indian caste system. Narrated by David Carradine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston

results.title: Age of exploration: Spanish explorers
results.creator_credit: Robert H. Black and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Depicts the discovery of America, through the eyes of the Spanish explorers. Discusses Spain’s reasons for exploration and shows the conquests of Cortez, Pizarro and others in the New World.

results.title: Aftermath
results.brief_description: Dramatisation of a man who has been disabled and put into a wheel chair after an on-the-job accident. It explores his trials and tribulations of adjusting to a new life and facing his family etc. This film is designed to encourage the audience to think seriously about safety. A Teacher’s Guide is supplied. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: After work
results.brief_description: This film shows that human beings are not machines to be shut down at night; change and recreation are needed to keep well and happy in war or in peace. Of interest to industries, this film demonstrates how factory management, civic groups and workers themselves establish recreational centers, where dancing, swimming, singing, handicrafts and many other sports and hobbies are enjoyed. Canadians use their time after work to become healthy, informed citizens

results.title: After the whale
results.creator_credit: L. Richard Ellison and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Around Us”.
Probably the most misunderstood animal, the whale is shown in this film to be a playful, shy, browsing mammal, defenceless against us and on the verge of extinction.

results.title: After the harvest
results.creator_credit: Robin Wischusen, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Overviews the marketing of horticultural products in both domestic and international markets with basic marketing principles being applied to specialised products from the commercial garden. Topics discussed: understanding the market, buyer behaviour, packaging, storage, the impact of chemical use, pricing, competition, market research and an analysis of the technological developments which ensure a product is delivered in a marketable condition.

results.title: After the 'ouch'
results.brief_description: After a series of small accidents, children apply first aid for a cut, splinter, bruise, nosebleed and minor burn. Also indicates correct response to a serious accident. Animation is used to show aspects of physiology. Suitab le for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: After love = Apres l'armour [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Diane Kurys, Jean-Bernard Fetoux, Alexandre Films, Prodeve and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description: Directed and written by Diane Kurys, “Apres l’amour” is the tale of Lola (Isabelle Huppert), a passionate woman caught between the two men in her life. Lola is a professional writer of independent means, living in Paris. Her long-term lover with whom she lives is David (Bernard Giraudeau), an architect. Marianne (Lio), his wife and mother of his two children, longs for him to return to the family home. David is still sexually active with Marianne and involved in their children’s lives. Lola meanwhile, is having an affair with a musician, Tom (Hippolyte Giradot), who is also married. Tom’s wife, Elisabeth, is aware of his extra-marital activities but is confident, as the mother of his children, of her power over him. Lola writes about her affairs with both men, pondering the meaning of her connection to them. Elisabeth and Marianne (the respective wives) are driven to despair by their husbands’ indiscretions. The film tracks a year in the life of the characters as they struggle to gain a sense of power over their relationships. “Apres l’amour” is a film about love, sex, marriage, commitment, parenthood and fidelity. Also starring Yvan Attal as David’s brother, Romain. In French with English subtitles.
